metadata.titleEn: Specimen and genetic resource database of Amphipoda in the Tibetan Plateau (2000-2019)
metadata.description: 1) data content: including class, order, Chinese name of family, Latin name of family, Chinese name of genus, Latin name of genus, Latin name of species, Chinese name of species, country, province and distribution area; 2) data source and processing method: record species composition and distribution range of freshwater Amphipoda in the Tibetan Plateau and pan third pole field based on scientific research from 2000 to 2019; 3) data quality description : the sampling and testing personnel have been trained strictly in the laboratory. In the process of sample collection, it shall be kept at low temperature and delivered to the laboratory within the specified time. In the process of laboratory analysis, the samples are determined repeatedly to ensure the quality of test data. 4) data application achievements and prospects: Taking the dominant group of Amphipoda in the Tibetan Plateau as the research object, focusing on the theme of the impact of climate and environmental change on biodiversity and the response of organisms to environmental change, obtain the species number, distribution and genetic data of Amphipoda in the water system of the Tibetan Plateau and the pan third polar lakes.
metadata.instructions: File name: the specimen and genetic resource database 20191211 of Amphipoda in the Tibetan Plateau is stored in tabular format. The file name is "specimen and genetic resource database 20191211 of Amphipoda in the Tibetan Plateau", in which 2019 represents the year and 1211 represents the generation date. Data reading method: the data can be opened directly with Excel.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of data collection methods used for gathering information on freshwater crustaceans in high-altitude regions?
Feature Specification.Answer: species composition, distribution range, specimen collection, preservation under low temperatures, timely delivery to laboratories, rigorously trained personnel, repeated measurements

Quantification.Question: How many species of freshwater crustaceans are recorded in a dataset focused on the distribution and composition from 2000 to 2019 on the Tibetan Plateau?
Quantification.Answer: The original answer does not provide a specific numerical value for the number of species of freshwater crustaceans recorded in the dataset. Therefore, there is no numerical data to extract or refine.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the likely consequences on data quality and biodiversity insights when using samples collected under strict laboratory training and low-temperature preservation methods for studying freshwater crustaceans in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using samples collected under strict laboratory training and low-temperature preservation methods ensures high-quality data, which enhances the reliability of biodiversity insights related to the species composition and distribution of freshwater crustaceans in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. This approach likely results in accurate and reproducible genetic data, allowing researchers to better understand the impact of climate and environmental changes on biodiversity in this region.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to establish a dataset of amphipods from the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau and the Third Pole regions, focusing on their species composition and distribution from 2000 to 2019?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal is to study the impact of climate and environmental changes on biodiversity and how organisms, specifically amphipods, respond to these changes. This involves obtaining data on species abundance, distribution, and genetic information within lake systems of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau and the Third Pole regions.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are followed to ensure the quality and accuracy of data collected about amphipods in the Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau and surrounding regions from 2000 to 2019?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The collected samples were handled by personnel who underwent rigorous laboratory training. Throughout the sample collection process, samples were preserved at low temperatures and delivered to the laboratory within a specified time frame. During laboratory analysis, repeated measurements were conducted to ensure the quality of the detection data.

Enablement.Question: What methodologies enable the accurate collection and preservation of freshwater crustacean specimens in high-altitude regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Enablement.Answer: The methodologies include conducting field surveys in the Tibetan Plateau and surrounding Third Pole regions from 2000 to 2019 to record species composition and distribution. The specimens are collected by personnel who have received rigorous laboratory training, preserved at low temperatures during collection, and delivered to the laboratory within the specified time frame to ensure quality. Repeated measurements during laboratory analysis further ensure data accuracy.
